alert.note: Alert for Berks; Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 3:12AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Berks, northwestern Lehigh, Carbon and Monroe Counties through 415 AM EDT... At 310 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Scranton to Lebanon. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lehighton, Mount Pocono, Tobyhanna, Palmerton, Jim Thorpe, Hamburg, Slatington, Sinking Spring, Nesquehoning, Womelsdorf, Weatherly, Wernersville, Walnutport, Robesonia, Leesport, Shoemakersville, Bernville, Strausstown, Lenhartsville and Pocono Pines. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 67 and 97. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 42. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 278 and 303. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
